Segment-Triggered Campaign Flows in Marketing Cloud Growth

Segment-triggered campaign flows send messages based on segment membership. The preconfigured campaign flow includes only email messages, but you can add SMS messages to any segment-triggered flow if you have the paid SMS add-on.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Salesforce Enterprise and Unlimited Editions with Marketing Cloud Growth Edition
Single Email Campaign Flows

When you’re sending a single email, you configure everything from the campaign record. Before you can activate the campaign flow, you must select an audience segment, edit and publish your email content, and set a schedule for sending.

If you don’t want to schedule your email for the future, use the Send Now option in the Schedule section. This option immediately activates the campaign flow and queues your email to send. To schedule or send the email, activate the campaign flow from the campaign record or in Flow Builder.

To add a message, click and open the campaign flow.

Message Series Campaign Flows

When you’re creating a series of emails, you can select a segment (1) and edit each email from the campaign record. To schedule messages and activate your campaign flow, open Flow Builder. The related campaign flow comes with two emails that you can customize to meet your needs (2).

Refreshing Segment Data

Segment membership is updated according to the segment’s publish schedule. When you activate a campaign flow, you have the option to use the segment’s publish schedule, or to republish the segment immediately before the campaign flow runs. These options are also accessible in Flow Builder when you configure the segment on the Start element.

To help ensure you’re using the most up-to-date segment data, select the option to republish your segment immediately before the flow runs.

Deactivating Message Campaigns

To deactivate a message series, open the campaign flow in Flow Builder, and then click Deactivate in the button bar. For single email campaigns, deactivate from the campaign record.

When you deactivate a campaign flow for a single email from the campaign record, the flow completes and sends any remaining messages. When you deactivate a recurring campaign flow, the flow finishes the current run and doesn’t repeat.

To deactivate and stop all future scheduled emails from sending, edit the campaign flow in Flow Builder, and then use the deactivate and cancel option.

Using SMS Messages in Campaigns

You can add SMS messages to any segment-triggered flow. First, create an SMS message on the Content tab. Then, add it to the flow for an existing campaign. If you don’t need emails in your flow, you can delete the email elements.
